required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Milademetan in Japanese Patients With Relapsed or Refractory Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML)
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 1, Open-label, Dose Escalation Study of Milademetan, an Oral MDM2 Inhibitor, to Assess Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics in Japanese Patients With Relapsed or Refractory Acute Myeloid Leukemia

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase 1, multicenter, open-label study to evaluate safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics of milademetan in Japanese patients with relapsed or refractory acute myeloid leukemia. The milademetan initial dose will be Level 1: 90 mg. No increase in the milademetan dose will be made in the same participant. Dose-limiting toxicity associated with milademetan occurring at each level will be assessed, and the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) will be decided using a modified continuous reassessment method (mCRM).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Dose Limiting Toxicities (DLTs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: at approximately 28 days after start of treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with treatment emergent adverse events (TEAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: through completion of follow-up, within approximately 1 year

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1: Day 1, 2, 8, 14; Cycle 2: Day 1 (within approximately 29 days)
Cycle 1: Day 1, 2, 8, 14; Cycle 2: Day 1 (within approximately 29 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the drug concentration-time curve (AUC) to the last observable concentration (AUClast)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1: Day 1, 2, 8, 14; Cycle 2: Day 1 (within approximately 29 days)
Cycle 1: Day 1, 2, 8, 14; Cycle 2: Day 1 (within approximately 29 days)

arm_group.description: All participants enrolled for dose escalation receive a single oral dose of 90 mg milademetan, followed by escalated doses, based on mCRM with EWOC

intervention.description: Milademetan, an MDM2 inhibitor, is provided in capsules for oral administration

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Relapsed or refractory AML
- AML for which no standard treatment is available
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status (PS) of 0 to 2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Acute Promyelocytic Leukemia
- Chronic myelogenous leukemia in blast crisis (BCR-ABL fusion gene positive)
- Presence of central nervous system involvement of leukemia or a history of primary central nervous system leukemia

facility.name: National Hospital Organization Kumamoto Medical Center
National Hospital Organization Disaster Medical Center

patient_data.ipd_description: De-identified individual participant data (IPD) and applicable supporting clinical trial documents may be available upon request at https://vivli.org/. In cases where clinical trial data and supporting documents are provided pursuant to our company policies and procedures, Daiichi Sankyo will continue to protect the privacy of our clinical trial participants. Details on data sharing criteria and the procedure for requesting access can be found at this web address: https://vivli.org/ourmember/daiichi-sankyo/
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Studies for which the medicine and indication have received European Union (EU) and United States (US), and/or Japan (JP) marketing approval on or after 01 January 2014 or by the US or EU or JP Health Authorities when regulatory submissions in all regions are not planned and after the primary study results have been accepted for publication.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Formal request from qualified scientific and medical researchers on IPD and clinical study documents from clinical trials supporting products submitted and licensed in the United States, the European Union and/or Japan from 01 January 2014 and beyond for the purpose of conducting legitimate research. This must be consistent with the principle of safeguarding study participants' privacy and consistent with provision of informed consent.
